vocabulary.example: have no business -ing [exp] - not supposed to be -ing
do (s/o) a solid [exp] - do a favor for (someone), help (someone)
tattoos [n] - designs on skin made with ink
earn [v] - get something by working for it
a demigod [n] - part human, part god
the Heart [n] - the Heart of Te Fiti

questions.question: Maui makes fun of Moana for helping him escape from Tamatoa.
Maui is worried that Moana could die if they face Te Kā.
Maui cannot control his magic fishhook anymore.
Moana thinks that their mission is cursed.
Maui's tattoos represent the things he has accomplished.
Maui's parents were killed by Te Kā.
Maui's parents gave him his magic fishhook.
Maui gave fire and coconuts to the humans.
Maui's tattoo is angry at him.

grammar.explanation: Choose the word and place in the sentence that most logically connects the ideas in the sentence. Use words like: took, be, like, being, it, at, give, up, wasn't, by, went, would, who, are. Some boxes will be empty.

exercises.sentence: I’m trying to ___ sincere for once, and it feels like you’re distracted.
Because you’re looking at me ___ I have a shark head.
For a little girl who had no business ___ down there, you did me a solid.
We’re never making ___ to Te Fiti.
Are you going to ___ me a speech?
They show ___ when I earn them.
They ___ one look and decided they did not want me.
Somehow, I was found ___ the gods.
And back to the humans I ___.
You did everything for them so they ___ love you.
But the gods aren’t the ones ___ make you Maui. You are.

transcript.full:
Moana: We’re alive! We’re aliv...

Maui: Listen. I appreciate what you did down there.

Moana: Mm-hmm.

Maui: It took guts.

Moana: Mm-hmm. Mm-hmm. Mm-hmm.

Maui: But ah... I’m sorry. I’m trying to be sincere for once, and it feels like you’re distracted.

Moana: No. no. No way!

Maui: Really? Because you’re looking at me like I have a shark head.

Moana: What? Do you have a shark head? Cuz...

Maui: Look, the point is, for a little girl, child, thing, whatever, who had no business being down there, you did me a solid. But you also almost died. And I couldn’t even beat the dumb crab. So, chances of beating Te Kā? Bupkis. We’re never making it to Te Fiti. This mission is cursed.

Moana: It’s not cursed.

Maui: Shark head.

Moana: It is not cursed.

Maui: Cursed.

Maui: ♪ What can I say except we’re dead soon. We’re dead soon. ♪

Moana: Can you at least try?

Maui: Giant hawk. Hey, it’s okay, it’s okay. We’re dead soon.

Moana: All right. Break time’s over. Get up.

Maui: Why? Are you going to give me a speech? Tell me I can beat Te Kā because I’m Maui? Take a hike, tiny.

Moana: How do you get your tattoos?

Maui: They show up when I earn them.

Moana: How did you earn that one? What’s that for?

Maui: I wasn’t born a demigod. I had human parents. They took one look and decided they did not want me. They threw me into the sea like I was nothing. Somehow, I was found by the gods. They gave me the hook. They made me Maui. And back to the humans I went. I gave them islands, fire, coconuts. Anything they could ever want.

Moana: You took the Heart for them. You did everything for them so they’d love you.

Maui: It was never enough.

Moana: But the gods aren’t the ones who make you Maui. You are.

Maui: Okay, okay. I love you, too, buddy.
